subject: WARNING ABOUT SELF-CONFIDENCE
verse: Look here, you people who say, “Today or tomorrow we are going to a certain town and stay there a year. We will do business and make a profit.” How do you know what will happen tomorrow? For your life is like the morning fog—it is here a little while, then it is gone. (James 4:13, 14)
reflection:
It is good to make plans, but they will disappoint us if we leave God out of them. There is no point in making plans as though God does not exist, because the future is in His hands. What would you like to be doing ten years from now? One year from now? Tomorrow? How will you
react if God steps in and rearranges your plans?
prayer: Plan ahead, BUT ask for Gods guidance, seek God’s will in your planning, He will never disappoint you.
original_content:
message_id: 179c9bbb3a76fa3a
subject   : Subject: WARNING ABOUT SELF-CONFIDENCE (6-1-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 1 Jun 2021 17:39:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Look here, you people who say, “Today or tomorrow we **are going to a
certain town and stay there a year. We will **do business and make a
profit.” How do you know what **will happen tomorrow? For your life is like
the morning fog—it is here a little while, then *

*it is gone. *Jm. 4:13, 14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It is good to make plans, *but* they will disappoint

us *if* we leave God out of them. There is no point

in making plans as though God does not exist, because the future is in His
hands*. *What would

you like to be doing ten years from now*? *One

year from now? Tomorrow? How will you

react if God steps in and rearranges your plans?

*Pastor Sather*

*Plan ahead, *BUT ask for Gods guidance, seek God’s will in your planning,
He will never disap-point you.

subject: OUR FAITH MUST EXPRESS ITSELF IN ACTIONS
verse: Remember, it is sin to know what you ought to  do and not do it. (James 4:17)
reflection: We tend to think that doing wrong is sin. But James tells us that, sin is also not doing right. (these two kinds of sin are sometimes called sins of commission and sins of omissions.) It is a sin to lie, it can also be a sin to know the truth and not tell it. It is a sin to speak evil of someone; it is also a sin to avoid that person when you know he or she needs your friendship. You should be willing to help as the Holy Spirit guides you. If God has directed you to do a kind act, to render a service, or to restore a relationship, do it.
prayer: If you do so, you will experience a renewed and refreshed vitality to your Christian faith.
original_content:
message_id: 179c9fed70343f8a
subject   : Subject: OUR FAITH MUST EXPRESS ITSELF IN ACTIONS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 1 Jun 2021 18:53:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(6-2-21)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Remember, it is sin to know what you ought to *

*do and not do it. *(Jm. 4:17)

*Today’s Reflection:*

We tend to think that doing wrong is sin. But

James tells us that, sin is also not doing right.

(these two kinds of sin are sometimes called

sins of commission and sins of omissions.)

It is a sin to lie, it can also be a sin to know

the truth and not tell it. It is a sin to speak

evil of someone; it is also a sin to avoid that

person when you know he or she needs your friendship. You should be willing
to help as

the Holy Spirit guides you. If God has directed

you to do a kind act, to render a service, or to

restore a relationship, *do it.*

*Pastor Sather*

*If you do so, you will experience a renewed *

*and refreshed vitality to your Christian faith.*

subject: PATIENCE--PATIENCE
verse: Dear brothers and sisters, you must be patient as  you wait for the Lord’s return. Consider the farmers who eagerly look for the rains in the fall and the spring. They patiently wait for the precious harvest  to ripen. You too, must be patient! (James 5:7, 8a)
reflection: I think we all know that the farmer cannot rush the growth of his crops. But he does not take the summer off. There is a lot of work to do to ensure a good crop. In the same way, we must wait patient ly for Christ’s return. We can not make Him come back any sooner. But while we wait, there is much work that we can do to advance God’s Kingdom. Both the Christian and the farmer must look toward the future reward for their labors.
prayer: Don’t live as though Christ will never return . . . . . .
original_content:
message_id: 179cee08cc186a72
subject   : Subject: PATIENCE--PATIENCE (6-3-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 2 Jun 2021 17:38:13 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Dear brothers and sisters, you must be patient as *

*you wait for the Lord’s return. Consider the farmers who eagerly look for
the rains in the fall and the spring. They patiently wait for the precious
harvest *

*to ripen. You too, must be patient! *(Jm. 5:7, 8a)



*Today’s Reflection:*

I think we all know that the farmer cannot rush

the growth of his crops. But he does not take the summer off. There is a
lot of work to do to ensure

a good crop. In the same way, we must wait patient-

ly for Christ’s return. We can not make Him come back any sooner. But while
we wait, there is much work that we can do to advance God’s Kingdom. Both
the Christian and the farmer must look toward the future reward for their
labors.

*Pastor Sather*

*Don’t live as though Christ will never return . . . . . . *

subject: COURAGE WITH PATIENCE
verse: Don’t grumble about each other, my brothers  and sisters, or God will judge you. For look!  The great judge is coming, He is standing at  the door. (James 5: 9)
reflection: When things go wrong, we tend to grumble and blame others for our miseries. Blaming others is easier than owning our share of the respond sibility, it can be both destructive and sinful. Before you blame others for their shortcomings, remember that Christ the judge will come to evaluate each of us. (Matthew 7:1-5).
prayer: He will not let us get away with shifting the blame to others.
original_content:
message_id: 179d3e902af22c5a

*Today’s Verse:*

*Don’t grumble about each other, my brothers *

*and sisters, or God will judge you. For look! *

*The great judge is coming, He is standing at *

*the door. *(Jm. 5: 9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When things go wrong, we tend to grumble and blame others for our miseries.
Blaming others

is easier than owning our share of the respon-

sibility, it can be both destructive and sinful.

Before you blame others for their short-comings, remember that Christ the
judge will come to eval-uate each of us. (Mt. 7:1-5).

*Pastor Sather*

*He will not let us get away with shifting the blame to others.*

subject: A SIMPLE YES OR NO
verse: Most of all my brothers and sisters, never take  an oath,by heaven and earth or anything else.  Just say a simple yes or no, so that you will  not sin and be condemned for it. (James 5:12)
reflection: A person with the reputation of exaggerating or lying often can’t get anyone to believe him or his word alone. Christians should never be like that. Always be honest so that others will believe your simple yes or no. By avoiding lies, and half-truths, and the omissions of the truth, you will become known as a trustworthy person.
prayer: Make a reputation of being honest at all times.
original_content:
message_id: 179d92dcde35c35a
subject   : Subject: A SIMPLE YES OR NO (6-5-12)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 4 Jun 2021 17:38:48 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Most of all my brothers and sisters, never take *

*an oath,**by heaven and earth or anything else. *

*Just say a simple **yes or no, so that you will *

*not **sin and be condemned for **it. *(Jm. 5:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

A person with the reputation of exaggerating

or lying often can’t get anyone to believe him

or his word alone. Christians should never be

like that. Always be honest so that others will

believe your simple yes or no. *By avoiding* lies,

and half-truths, and the omissions of the truth,

you will become known as a trustworthy person.

*Pastor Sather*

*Make a reputation of being honest at all times.*

subject: A FALLEN BELIEVER
verse: My dear brothers and sisters, if anyone among  you wonders from the truth and is brought back again, you can be sure that the one who brings  that person back will save that sinner from death  and bring about the forgiveness of many sins. (James 5:19, 20)
reflection: We have come to the end of the book of James. What we should have leaned is the importance of faith in action. Right living should be the evid ence and result of faith. The church must serve with compassion, speak lovingly and truthfully, live in obedience to God’ commands, and love one another. The body of believers ought to be an example of heaven on earth , drawing people to Christ through love for God and each other. If we truly believe God’s Word, we will live it day by day. God’s Word is not merely something we read or think about, but something we do.
prayer: REMEMBER, belief, faith and trust must have hands and feet-ours.
original_content:
message_id: 179ddde585e3399e
subject   : Subject: A FALLEN BELIEVER (6-6-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 5 Jun 2021 15:30:07 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*My dear brothers and sisters, if anyone among *

*you won**ders from the truth and is brought back again, you can be sure
that the one who brings *

*that person back will save** that sinner from death *

*and bring about the forgiveness **of many sins.*




*Today’s Reflection: *We have come to the end of the book of James.

What we should have leaned is the importance

of faith in action. Right living should be the evid-

ence and result of faith. The church *must* serve

with compassion, speak lovingly and truthfully*, *

live in obedience to God’ commands, and love

one another. The body of believers ought to be

an example of heaven *on *earth*, *drawing people

to Christ through love for God and each other.

If we truly believe God’s Word, we will live it day

by day. God’s Word is not merely something we

read or think about, *but something we do.*

*Pastor Sather*

*REMEMBER, belief, faith and trust must have hands **and feet—ours.*

subject: STUDY OF PROVERBS
verse: As we go through Proverbs, from each section I will share one or two verses, then reflect on the whole section. Today’s Verse The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom  and instruction. (Proverbs 9:10)
reflection:
of today’s section:
Solomon’s introduction reminds us of the difference between true wisdom and the wisdom of the world. True Wisdom is from the Lord, a message that is foolish ess to those who reject it, but it is God’s very power to us who are being saved (I Corinthians 1:18).
prayer: Prayer: Lord, teach us true wisdom and give us its power to love and serve You. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 179e264cbdffd58f
subject   : Subject: STUDY OF PROVERBS (July 7-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 6 Jun 2021 12:35:27 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Home Work**—read--Verses: *(Pro. 1:1-7)



As we go through Proverbs, from each section

I will share one or two verses, then reflect on the

whole section.


*Today’s Verse*

*The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom *

*and instruction. *(vs. 7)



*The Reflection of today’s section:*

Solomon’s introduction reminds us of the

difference between true wisdom and the

wisdom of the world. *True Wisdom*—

is from the Lord, a message that is foolish-

ess to those who reject it, *but* *it *is God’s

very power to us who are being saved

(I Cor. 1:18).

*Pastor Sather*


*Prayer:** Lord, teach us true wisdom and give *

*us its** power to love and serve You. Amen.*

subject: THE ENTICEMENT OF SINNERS
verse:
Such are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust gain;
it takes away the life of it’s possessors. (Proverbs 1:19)
reflection: In vss. 8-19 Solomon warns against joining sinners in their adventurous plots, cautioning that the greedy and violent will eventually receive their due reward-a well deserved punishment. But through the means of grace, God in Christ, strengthens and preserves His people, that is every true believer, just as He forgives all our sins for Jesus sake.
prayer: Dear Lord, keep us from drifting into temptation, but deliver us from evil. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 179e880cc6f31d6c
subject   : Subject: THE ENTICEMENT OF SINNERS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 7 Jun 2021 17:03:46 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*PLEASE Read: Pro. 1:8-19*



*Today’s Verse: *(Pro. 1:19)

*Such are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust **gain; it takes
away the life of it’s possessors. *(Pro.1:19)



*Today’s Reflection: *

In vss. 8-19 Solomon warns against joining sinners

in their adventurous plots, cautioning that the greedy and violent will
eventually receive their due reward—a well deserved punishment. *But
through *the means of grace, God in Christ, strengthens and preserves His
people, that is every true believer,

just as He forgives all our sins for Jesus sake.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, keep us from drifting into temptation, but deliver us from
evil. **Amen.*

subject: TOTAL REVERANCE FOR GOD
verse: If you seek wisdom like silver and search for it like hidden  treasures, then you will understand the fear of the Lord and find the knowledge of God. (Proverbs 2:4, 5)
reflection: The fear of God is reverence for God and the spiritual worship of Him. This phrase is found throughout Scriptures. we need to remember, that the worship of God does not consist of works, no matter how great and holy they may be. God promises to give understanding to those who revere Him as their God and Father.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would fulfill in me a healthy reverence for You, so that I would grow in total respect for you as Abraham did. Amen. . .
original_content:
message_id: 179f2a3d8e806dc5
subject   : Subject: TOTAL REVERANCE FOR GOD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 9 Jun 2021 16:18:15 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Please read* (Pro. 2:1-10)

*Today's Verses:*
*If you seek wisdom like silver and search for it like hidden *
*treasures, **then you will understand the fear of the Lord and*
*find the knowledge of God. *(Pro. 2:4, 5)

*Today's Reflection:*
*The fear of God* is reverence for God and the spiritual worship
of Him. This phrase is found throughout Scriptures. we need
to remember, that the *worship* of God does not consist of
works, no matter how great and holy they may be. God
promises to give understanding to those who revere Him
as their God and Father.
*Pastor Sather*
*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit*
*would fulfill in me a healthy reverence for You, so*
*that I would grow in total respect for you as*
*Abraham did. Amen.*
. *. *

subject: DISCRETION THE BETTER PART OF VALOR
verse: Discretion will watch over you, understanding  will guard you, delivering you from the way of  evil, from men of perverted speech.  (Proverbs 2:11, 12)
reflection: As you continue to read Proverbs you will notice that it often teaches a “two way” theology. There are two ways, one of life, and one of death., you will notice there is a great difference between the two ways. The way of goodness is followed by those who trust in the Lord for salvation,and of course the way of evil, followed by the ungod ly. Those who leave the right path for the way of evil eventually come to realize and delight in the way they have chosen. It all happened through the effective working of the devil, what is repulsive at first becomes interesting, then acceptable, and finally a source of sinful delight.
prayer: Dear Lord help us not to fall into the devious path Satan sets for us. Amen.
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*Discretion will watch over you, understanding *

*will guard you, delivering you from the way of *

*evil, from men of per-verted speech. *

(Pro. 2:11, 12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

As you continue to read Proverbs you will notice

that it often teaches a “*two way” *theology. There

are two ways, one of life, and one of death., you

will notice there is a great difference between the

*two ways. *The *way of good**ness* is followed by

those who trust in the Lord for salvation,and

of course *the way of evil*, followed by the ungod-

ly. Those who leave the *right* path for the way of

evil eventually come to realize and delight in the

way they have chosen. *It all happened through *

*the effective working** of the devil, what is repul-sive at first becomes
interes**ting, then acceptable, and finally a source of sinful delight.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord help us not to fall into the devious *

*path **Satan sets for us. **Amen.*

subject: A TOTAL TRUST IN GOD Please Read
verse: Never let loyalty and kindness get away from you! Wear them like a necklace; write them deep within  your heart. (Proverbs 3:3)
reflection:
Loyalty and kindness are important character traits.
Both involve actions as well as attitudes. A loyal
person acts responsibly. A kind person works for justice for others.
Thoughts and words are not enough. Our life reveals whether we are truly loyal and kind. Do your actions measure up to your attitudes? IF you read vs. 6 you would have seen that it said; “Seek the Lord in all you do, and He will direct your paths.” Please remember He knows what is best for us. He is a better judge of what is best for us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always put my complete trust in You. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a01d1a6bb64467
subject   : Subject: A TOTAL TRUST IN GOD Please Read (Pro. 3:1-6)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 12 Jun 2021 15:02:35 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verse:*

*Never let loyalty and kindness get away from you!*

*Wear them like a necklace; write them deep within *

*your heart. *(Pro. 3:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Loyalty and kindness are important character traits.

Both involve actions as well as attitudes. A loyal

person acts responsibly. A kind person works for

justice for others. Thoughts and words are not enough.

Our life reveals whether we are truly loyal and kind.

Do your actions measure up to your attitudes? * IF*

you read vs. 6 you would have seen that it said;

*“Seek the Lord in all you do, and He will direct **your *

*paths.” *Please remember He knows what is best for

us. He is a better judge of what is best for us.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always put *

*my **complete trust in You. **Amen.*

subject: TO TEACH AND TO TRAIN
verse: My child do not ignore it when the Lord disciplines you,  and do not be discouraged when He correctsyou. For the  Lord corrects those He loves, just as a father corrects a  child in whom he delights. (Proverbs 3:10-11)
reflection:
It is difficult to know when God has be disciplining us until we look back on the situation later. Not every calamity comes from God, of course. But if we rebel against God and refuse to repent when God has identified some sin in our life, He may
use guilt, crises, or bad experiences to bring us back to Him. Sometimes, however, difficult times come even when there is no flagrant sin in our life. Then our response should be patience, integrity, and confidence that God will show us what to do.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, it is my eternal wish that I will make You a vital part of my life. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a0c6ed104009f1
subject   : 
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 14 Jun 2021 16:30:27 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: TO TEACH AND TO TRAIN *(Pro. 3:10-11)


*Today’s Verses:*

*My child do not ignore it when the Lord disciplines **you,*

*and do **not be discouraged when He corrects**you. For **the *

*Lord corrects those He loves, just as **a father corrects **a *

*child in whom he delights.*



*Today’s Reflection:*

It is difficult to know when God has be disciplining us until

we look back on the situation later. Not every calamity comes

from God, of course. But if we rebel against God and refuse

to repent when God has identified some sin in our life, He may

use guilt, crises, or bad experiences to bring us back to Him.

Sometimes, however, difficult times come even when there

is no flagrant sin in our life. Then our response should be

patience, integrity, and confidence that God will show us what

to do.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, it is my eternal wish that **I will make *

*You a vital part of my life. **Amen.*

subject: SEEK OUT THOSE IN NEED
verse: Do not withhold good from those who deserve it when  it is in your power to help them. If you can help your  neighbor now, don’t say, “come back tomorrow, and then I will help you.” (Proverbs 3:27, 28)
reflection:
Withholding good is inconsiderate and unfair, whether
it is repaying a loan, returning a tool, or fulfilling a
promise. Withholding destroys trust and creates a great
inconvenience for the other person. Be as eager to do good as you are to have good done to you.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father help me become secure in and steady in Your Word as I walk in Your path.
original_content:
message_id: 17a11b32876252ca
subject   : Subject: SEEK OUT THOSE IN NEED (Please Read Pro. 3:21-28)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 15 Jun 2021 17:03:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verse:*

*Do not withhold good from those who deserve it when *

*it is in your power to help them. If you can help your *

*neighbor now, don’t say, “come back tomorrow, and*

*then I will help you.” *(Pro. 3:27, 28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Withholding good is inconsiderate and unfair, whether

it is repaying a loan, returning a tool, or fulfilling a

promise*. *Withholding destroys trust and creates a great

inconvenience for the other person. *Be as eager to do*

*good as you are to have good done to you**.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father help me become secure in*

*and steady in Your Word** as I walk in Your path*.

subject: FIVE DON'TS
verse: Do not plot against your neighbors; don't copy their ways. Do not make accusations against someone who hasn't wronged you. do not envy evil people; do not copy their ways. (Proverbs 3:29-31)
reflection: Romans 12:18 tells us, we are to do our part to live in peace with everyone, as far as possible. We should never envy evil people, even though some may be extremely popular, or extremely rich. No matter how much they have, it will fade and vanish like grass that withers and dies. those who follow God live differently from the wicked, and in the end, will have treasures in heaven.
prayer: Dear Lord help me remain faithful so that I will receive the eternal price.

*Do not* plot against your neighbors; *don't cop*y their ways.
*Do not* make accusations against someone who hasn't
wronged you. *do not* envy evil people; *do not *copy their
ways. (Pro. 3:29-31)

*Today's Reflection:*
Ro. 12:18 tells us, we are to do our part to live in peace
with everyone, as far as possible. We should never envy
evil people, even though some may be extremely popular,
or extremely rich. No matter how much they have, it will
fade and vanish like grass that withers and dies. those
who follow God live differently from the wicked, and in the
end, will have treasures in heaven.
*Pastor Sather*
*Dear Lord help me remain faithful so that I will receive*
*the eternal price. *

subject: A FATHER'S WISE ADVICE
verse: My father told me, “Take my words to heart. Follow my instructions and you will live. (Proverbs 4:4)
reflection:
One of the greatest responsibilities of parents is to
encourage their children to become wise. Here Sol omon tells how his father, David, encouraged him
to seek wisdom when he was young see (I kings
2:1-9)
for David’s charge to his son. This encourage ment may have prompted Solomon to ask God for
an understanding mind above everything else (I
Kings 3:9). Wisdom can be passed from parents
to children, from generation to generation. Ultim ately, of course, all wisdom comes from God,
parents can only urge their children to turn to Him.
If your parent never taught you in this way, you
can learn from the Scriptures, and then create a
legacy of wisdom as you teach your own children.
prayer: Forgive me for missing this opportunity, please give me the opportunity to make this correction with my grandchildren. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a1bc879f74774e
subject   : Subject: A FATER'S WISE ADVICE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 17 Jun 2021 16:02:41 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: A FATHER’S WISE ADVICE *

*Please read* (Pro. 4:1-4)

*My Verse: *

*My father told me, “Take my words to heart. Follow*

*my instructions and you will live. *(Pro. 4:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

One of the greatest responsibilities of parents is to

encourage their children to become wise. Here Sol-

omon tells how his father, David, encouraged him

to seek wisdom when he was young see (I kings

2:1-9) for David’s charge to his son. This encourage-

ment may have prompted Solomon to ask God for

an understanding mind above everything else (I

Kings 3:9). Wisdom can be passed from parents

to children, from generation to generation. Ultim-

ately, of course, all wisdom comes from God,

parents can only urge their children to turn to Him.

If your parent never taught you in this way, you

can learn from the Scriptures, and then create a

legacy of wisdom as you teach your own children.

*Pastor Sather*

*Forgive me for missing this opportunity, please *

*give me the opportunity to make this correction*

*with my grandchildren. **Amen.*

subject: LET IT BE YOUR FIRST CHOICE
verse:
Getting wisdom is the most important thing you can do! And whatever else you do, get good judgment. 
(Proverbs 4:7)
reflection:
If you want wisdom, you must decide to go after it.
It takes resolve-a determination not to abandon the
search once you begin, no matter how difficult the
road may become. This is not a-once-in-a-life-time
step, but a daily process of choosing between two
paths the wicked (Proverbs 4:14- 17, 19) and the right eous (4: 18). Nothing else is more important or more
valuable.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father as You well know, too often we have sought to find riches instead wisdom for this we ask Your forgiveness...Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a20fc1fca77004
subject   : Subject: LET IT BE YOUR FIRST CHOICE (Please Read Pro. 4:5-9)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 18 Jun 2021 16:17:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verse:*

*Getting wisdom is the most important thing you can*

* do! And whatever else you do, get good judgement. *

(Pro. 4:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

If you want wisdom, you must decide to go after it.

It takes resolve—a determination not to abandon the

search once you begin, no matter how difficult the

road may become. This is not a-once-in-a-life-time

step*,* but a daily process of choosing between two

paths*—*the wicked (Pro. 4:14*—*17, 19) and the right-

eous (4: 18)*.* Nothing else is more important or more

valuable.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father as You well know, too often*

*we have sought to find riches instead wisdom for *

*this we ask Your forgiveness…**Amen.*

subject: IMPORTANCE OF WISE JUDGEMENT
verse:
Do not do as the wicked do, or follow the path of evil- doers.
Avoid their haunts. Turn away and go some- where  else, for evil people cannot sleep until they have done their evil deed for the day, (Proverbs 4:14-16a)
reflection:
Even friends can make you fall. It is difficult for people
to accept the fact that friends and acquaintance may lure
them to do wrong. Young people want to be accepted, so
they would never confront or criticize a friend for wrong
plans or actions. Many other people can’t see how their
friend’s actions could lead to trouble. While we should
be accepting of others, we need a healthy skepticism
about human behavior. When you feel yourself being
heavily influenced, proceed with caution. Don’t let your
friends cause you to fall into sin.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I pray that I may glean true wisdom while choosing new friends. . . Amen
original_content:
message_id: 17a25f44efb2174a
subject   : Subject: IMPORTANCE OF WISE JUDGEMENT (Please Read Pro. 4:10-17)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 19 Jun 2021 15:26:46 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verses:*

*Do not do as the wicked do, or follow the path of evil-*

*doers. Avoid their haunts. Turn away and go some-*

*where* *else, for evil people cannot sleep until they have*

*done their evil deed for the day, *(Pro. 4:14-16a)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Even friends can make you fall. It is difficult for people

to accept the fact that friends and acquaintance may lure

them to do wrong. Young people want to be accepted, so

they would never confront or criticize a friend for wrong

plans or actions. Many other people can’t see how their

friend’s actions could lead to trouble. While we should

be accepting of others, we need a healthy skepticism

about human behavior. When you feel yourself being

heavily influenced, proceed with caution. Don’t let your

friends cause you to fall into sin.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father I pray that I may glean true*

*wisdom while choosing new friends. . . **Amen*

subject: SET BOUNDARIES
verse: Look straight ahead, and fix your eyes on what lies before you. Mark out a straight path for you feet; then stick to the path and stay safe. (Proverbs 4: 25, 26)
reflection:
Our heart our feelings of love and desire dictates
to a great extent how we live because we always find
time to do what we enjoy. Solomon tells us to guard
our heart above all else, making sure we concentrate
on those desires that will keep us on the right path.
Make sure your affection lead you in the right dir section. Put boundaries on your desires. Don’t go after everything you see. Look straight ahead, keep your
eyes fix on your goal, and don’t get side tracked
on detours that lead to sin. . .
prayer: Dear Lord you know my every weakness, so You will hear me continuously make this request, keep me from falling into sin. . . Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a2ad52fa510e71
subject   : Subject: SET BOUNDARIES (Please Read Pro. 4:23-27)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 20 Jun 2021 14:10:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verses:*

*Look straight ahead, and fix your eyes on what lies*

*before you. Mark out a straight path for you feet;*

*then stick to the path and stay safe. *(Pro. 4: 25, 26)



*Todays Reflection:*

Our heart*—*our feelings of love and desire*—*dictates

to a great extent how we live because we always find

time to do what we enjoy*.* Solomon tells us to guard

our heart above all else*, *making sure we concentrate

on those desires that will keep us on the right path*.*

Make sure your affection lead you in the right dir*-*

ection*.* Put boundaries on your desires*. *Don’t go after

everything you see*. *Look straight ahead*, keep *your

eyes fix on your goal*,* and don’t get side tracked

on detours that lead to sin*. . .*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord you know my every weakness, so You*

*will hear me continuously make this request,*

*keep me from falling into sin. . . **Amen. *

subject: THE TRUTH WHEN WISDOM IS APPLIED (please read
verse: My son, pay attention to my wisdom; listen carefully to my  wise counsel. Then you will learn to be discreet and will store up knowledge. (Proverbs 5:1)
reflection: The book of Proverbs tells us about people who have wisdom and enjoy its benefits The person who has wisdom - is loving is faithful trusts the Lord puts God first turns away from evil knows right from wrong listens and learns does what is right. The benefits of wisdom - long prosperous life favor with God and people reputation for good judgment success health, vitality riches, honor, pleasure, peace protection--You must agree wisdom speak volumes
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father Scriptures tell us all things are possible with You, so, I pray for wisdom from You!
original_content:
message_id: 17a30589a241f5e7
subject   : Subject: THE TRUTH WHEN WISDOM IS APPLIED (please read (Pro. 5:1-6)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 21 Jun 2021 15:52:31 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verse:*

*My son, pay attention to my wisdom; listen carefully to my *

*wise counsel. Then you will learn to be discreet and will*

*store up knowledge. *(5:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The book of Proverbs tells us about people who have wisdom

and enjoy its benefits*—**The person who has **wisdom**—*

is loving*—*is faithful*—*trusts the Lord*—*puts God first*—*

turns away from evil*—*knows right from wrong*—*

listens and learns*—*does what is right.

*The benefits of wisdom**—**long prosperous life—favor *

*with God and people—reputation for good judgement—*

*success—health, vitality—riches, honor, pleasure, peace—*

*protection--You must agree wisdom speak volumes*

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father Scriptures tell us all things are*

*possible with You, so, I pray for wisdom from You! *

subject: IF ONLY I HAD!
verse: Oh why didn’t I listen to my teachers? Why didn’t I pay  attention to those who gave me instruction? (Proverbs 5:13)
reflection:
At the end of our life, it will be to late to ask for advice.
When desire is fully activated, people don’t want advice they want satisfaction. The best time to learn the dangers
of foolishness, of going after forbidden sex (or anything
else that is harmful) is long before temptation comes.
Resistance is easier if the decision has already been
made.
Don’t wait to see what happens. Prepare for temp station by deciding now how you will act when you face it.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I pray that I will always follow Your Holy Spirit’s guidance. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a356f4f86ed6d2
subject   : Subject: IF ONLY I HAD! (please read Pro. 5:11-14)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 22 Jun 2021 15:35:25 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*My Verse:*

*Oh why didn’t I listen to my teachers? Why didn’t I pay *

*attention to those who gave me instruction? *(Pro. 5:13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

At the end of our life, it will be to late to ask for advice.

When desire is fully activated, people don’t want advice—

they want satisfaction. The best time to learn the dangers

of foolishness, of going after forbidden sex (or anything

else that is harmful) is long before temptation comes.

Resistance is easier if the decision has already been

made. Don’t wait to see what happens. Prepare for temp-

tation by deciding now how you will act when you face it.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear heavenly Father, I pray that I will always follow*

*Your Holy Spirit’s guidance. **Amen. *

subject: Message: TO MARRIED COUPLES
verse: Drink water from your own well— share your love only with your wife. (  Proverbs 5:15)
reflection:
God never intended that marriage become boring,
lifeless, pleasureless, and dull. Sex is a gift God
gives to married people for their mutual enjoyment
Real happiness comes when we decide to find plea Sure in the spouse God has given us and to commit
ourselves to meeting his or her needs.The real danger
is in doubting that God knows And cares for us. We
then may resent His timing and carelessly pursue sex tual pleasure without His blessing.
prayer: Dear Lord help us to always respect the gift You have blessed us with, we thank You for understand ing our every need.

Sure in the spouse God has given us and to commit

ourselves to meeting his or her needs.The real danger

is in doubting that God knows And cares for us*. *We

then may resent His timeing and carelessly pursue sex-

tual pleasure without His blessing.

*Pastor Sather*

*ing our every need.*

subject: WISDOM CALLS FOR HEARING
verse: I, Wisdom, live together with good judgment. I know where to discover knowledge and discernment. All who fear the Lord will hate evil. That is why I hate pride,  arrogance, corruption, and perverted speech. (Proverbs 8:12-13)
reflection:
The more a person fears and respects God, the more he
or she will hate evil. Love for God and love for sin can not coexist. Harboring secret sins means that you are tolerating evil within yourself.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me make a clean break, with sin so that I can commit myself completely to You. Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17a5a11491331357

*I, Wisdom, live together with good judgement. I know*

*where to discover knowledge and discernment. All who*

* fear the Lord will hate evil. That is why I hate pride, *

*arrogance, corruption, and perverted speech.* (Pro. 8:12-13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The more a person fears and respects God, the more he

or she will hate evil. Love for God and love for sin can-

not coexist. Harboring secret sins means that you are

tolerating evil within yourself.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me make a clean break,*

*with sin so that I can commit myself completely to You. *

*Amen. *

subject: WORK TO ACCOMPLISH HIS WILL (Please Read Proverbs 3:7-10)
verse: Don't be impressed with your own wisdom. Instead, fear the Lord, and turn your back on evil. (Proverbs 3:7)
reflection: Solomon has said more than once in Scriptures, "We must seek God's will in all we do. This means turning every area of our life over to Him. We need to make Him a vital part of everything we do, then He will guide us, because we will be working to accomplish His purpose. What do you present to God--for your sins or what kind of plea for His forgiveness?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a better manager of the many blessings you have showered upon me. Amen.
original_content:
*My Verse:*
*Don't be impressed with your own wisdom. Instead, fear the Lord,*
*and turn your back on evil. *(Pro. 3:7)

*Today's Reflection:*
Solomon has said more than once in Scriptures, "We must seek God's
will in all we do. *This means* turning *every *area of our life over to
Him. We need to make Him a vital part of everything we do, then He
will guide us, because we will be working to accomplish His purpose.
What do you present to God--for your sins *or* what kind of plea for His
forgiveness?
*Pastor Sather*
*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a better manager of the many *
*blessings you have showered upon me. Amen.*

(Pro. 3:7) Today's Reflection: Solomon has said more than once in Scriptures, "We must seek God's will in all we do. This means turning every area of our life over to Him. We need to make Him a vital part of everything we do, then He will guide us, because we will be working to accomplish His purpose. What do you present to God--for your sins or what kind of plea for His forgiveness? Pastor Sather Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a better manager of the many blessings you have showered upon me. Amen.

subject: Five Don'ts
verse: Do not plot against your neighbors; don't copy their ways. Do not make accusations against someone who hasn't wronged you.. Do not envy violent people;' do not copy their ways. (Proverbs 3:29-31)
reflection: Romans 12-18 tells us, we are to do our part to live in peace with everyone, as far as possible. We should never envy evil people even though some may be extremely popular, or extremely rich. No matter how much they have, it will fade and vanish like grass that withers and dies, Those who follow God live differently from the wicked, and in the end, will have treasures in heaven.
prayer: Dear Lord help me remain faithful so that I will receive the eternal price. Amen.
original_content:
*Subject: FIVE DON'TS (Read Pro. 3:29-36)*



*MY Verses:*

*Do not** plot against your neighbors; don't copy their ways.*

*Do no**t make accusations against someone who hasn't *

*wronged you.. Do not envy violent people;' do not copy *

*their ways. (Pro. 3:29-31)*



*Today's Reflection:*

Ro. 12 18 tells us, we are to do our part to live in peace

with everyone, as far as possible. We should *never* envy

evil people even though some may be extremely popular,

or extremely rich. No matter how much they have, it will

fade and vanish like grass that withers and dies, Those

who follow God live differently from the wicked, and in

the end, will have treasures in heaven.

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord help me remain faithful so that I will receive*

*the eternal price.*
